review.description:
Great local marketplace!
Top Reasons Why:
- Super convenient. Open 24/7. Great for those late nights after the bar.
- Great variety of foods (breakfast, lunch and dinner), fresh juices, etc.
- Roast beef sandwich. Delicious AF.
- Awesome service all around.
review.author: Barney C.

review.description: Highly recommend. After a long week of vacay and eating out there sandwiches made for a simple supper. Had the Brooklyn bridge sandwich and the roll it was served on. Oh my word! Soft and delish. Also stopped there our first night of vacay and had the chicken kabobs and schwarma. Very tasty! Service was friendly and in addition to the food we also purchased some water and snacks to keep in room to avoid having to pay $3 bottle at hotel. Def walkable from Hampton Inn and encourage a visit.
review.author: Julie E.

review.description: They open 24/7. The food is subpar but the fact that they are open all the time is a plus. It is more on the expensive side. Prices are comparable to manhattan after all this is downtown Brooklyn. Ordered a turkey wrap for $7. The turkey meat was standard but tomatoes were sour. Added a ton of mayonnaise without me asking. Service is good though. They make the food quick for pick up.
review.author: Irene L.

review.description: Great staff very helpful. It's a deli /mini grocery store. Fresh produce! Toiletries were also available and they are 24hrs. Chicken and rice was an great treat at 3:30 am!
review.author: Rae S.

review.description: Great deli for sandwiches and groceries, but no bacon, or liquor, they are fully halal. Everybody so helpful and polite.
review.author: Whitley M.

review.description:
When you're awake and starving at 2am, a 24/7 deli is like an oasis in the desert.

The employees are kind and patient, and the deli offerings look fairly fresh and tasty. If you want to order something from the extensive menu, it's often easiest to order by number which is easier for them to identify. The quality of the sandwiches is pretty good, especially considering the fairly low prices. You can walk out the door with a hot sandwich in under 10 minutes!

Don't forget about the 10% discount on deli items for college students, and free delivery for orders over $10. 

Gold Street Market offers surprisingly upscale food items (fire-roasted poblanos in a jar? cambozola cheese?) and most items are definitely more expensive than they might be in other stores but that's the premium you pay for convenience and 24/7 access. The deli prices are still very competitive though with most hot sandwiches costing between $7-$8.50.
review.author: Nick H.

review.description: Avoid like the plague. Came here for lunch, fought my way through HS students, and had the guy behind the counter make me wait 15+ mins for one beef patty. He kept giving it away to people who came after me, and then told *me* to *relax* when he kept doing it. Then, he gave me a *microwaved* beef patty which disintegrated upon touch. People with such arrogance and lack of customer service don't deserve to be in business.
review.author: James R.

review.description: ** Texas Roast Beef: From the Grill ** Gold Street Market is the perfect place for some late night grub. The Texas Roast Beef Hero is crazy good, and is what I get every time I go. Don't be discouraged by the location or crammed interior.
review.author: Esther C.

review.description:
Very extensive menu of hot and cold foods available at the deli, ranging from burgers and wraps to salads and smoothies to pancakes and eggs. 

Food ordered will be made and ready within a few minutes; wait times are understandably longer during peak traffic hours, e.g. dinner time. 

Also quite a good supply of packaged foods including dried fruits, candies, chips, noodles, ice cream, sodas and juices, etc. As well, there is an aisle of household/cleaning supplies such as detergents and toilet paper. Fruit is typically available and of good quality. 

Employees are very kind, and in over a year of patronizing the market (several times per week), have never experienced hostility from any of the workers. 

The fact that it's open 24/7 is a huge plus, especially for those who live nearby and want to grab something quick.
review.author: Richard C.

review.description: Best deli Ive been to in NYC. So many sandwich and deli choices at a great price. Fresh produce, salad bar, and a daily hot bar for lunch. Cookies made daily and take online order and delivery. Fresh food like salmon and shrimp daily and any sweet or bag of chips you can think of! Also extremely clean and open 24/7.
review.author: Ari R.

review.description: Total ripoff asshole manager! This used to be my favorite deli until today. Bought an ice cream that was expired here, so I had to go back to the deli for a refund but the manager never apologized, saying the ice cream is only few days passed why I was making such a big deal about it.!! So I asked for a refund. The ice cream was $7.49, he paid $7.50 cash and told me I owe 1cent with an attitude. Never go to this deli, total ripoff.
review.author: Jihye P.

review.description: A very basic deli that has a prepared food section in the back. Lapin has tried their coffee and sandwiches and like them. The prices are decent and on par for other deli prices. They also sell bread at a competitive price. The staff are always nice when we visit.
review.author: Andie B.

review.description: The cheese burger was so fresh and tasted really good, I love this market,I've tasted different foods here,both the food and the staff are amazing!
review.author: Pegah K.

review.description:
Genuinely nice staff, open 24/7 and stocked full of things you ACTUALLY need? Amazing. It's about time too. 

I read up about this place on my building's blog and immediately went over. The first thing I noticed is that the two ladies working behind the cashier are super friendly and greet each and every customer. The second thing I noticed was that they had chicken and waffle lays + garlic cheesy bread lays. I have been looking for those for AGES. 

Unlike other bodega's in the area that shall remain unnamed, this place is much cleaner, and their produce looks fresh. Love.
review.author: Shu Jin S.

review.description: I come here between 3 & 4 times a week for small levels of groceries. This place has all the little things you need: toilet paper, various chips, a deli counter, cheese, etc. It's a godsend for when it's way too cold outside to function & you don't want to go far for food and don't feel like waiting for delivery. Also the clerks are very nice :)
review.author: Naomi Z.

review.description: Don't waste your time or money coming here. Their sandwich wraps are way too expensive and takes way too long to make. Also the lady at the counter will get mad if you try to pay with card, as she accepts cash. I am not sure if she is pocketing the cash, but that's not my concern. She just yells at me when I want to pay with my debt card and demands I pay with cash. It's very annoying.
review.author: James D.

review.description:
Since this came up in the restaurant section of yelp I am going to rate them based on their prepared food/deli counter only. 

It is just OK. Their menu is a pretty standard list of sandwiches, wraps, and paninis. The execution is fine, nothing to complain about but nothing to rate about either. 

Their biggest draw is that they are pretty cheap and offer a discount to students.
review.author: Christopher R.

review.description: Very extensive menu for everyone. Love that this place opens super late! For the price and taste they make pretty good wraps! One of the better chicken salad wraps I have had from a market / deli!
review.author: Jin C.

review.description: Market has a great variety of foods from fresh produce & healthy snacks of all sorts to fresh cookies, donuts and desserts. Also has a great hot foods selection. Reasonable prices
review.author: Karina K.

review.description:
Are ZERO stars possible?

Literally everything was jacked. Then staff of all men - sounds great if one of them is even possibly half forrest gump intelligent... or maybe decently looking. worse than  a dry bar at a wedding.
review.author: Cat M.
